Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class LightPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.LightPoller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class LightPoller
extends java.lang.Thread
    The LightPoller class has access to a lightsensor sample provider and is able to poll the current colour value. Each LightPoller object is initialized with a sample provider and a sample mode and outputs the values accordingly.
    Author:
    Xinyue Chen, Zheng Yu Cui, Alixe Delabrousse, David Kronish, Ariane Leroux

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightPoller

        public LightPoller​(lejos.hardware.sensor.EV3ColorSensor sensor,
                   java.lang.String mode)
        LightPoller constructor takes the correct sensor and its sensor more to initialize all values to be able to call the right polling method
        Parameters:
        sensor - reference to the physical sensor on the brick
        mode - how the sensor is used. e.g. "Red", "RGB"

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the polling thread continuously as long as the robot is navigating for side light pollers and as long as the robot is searching for colour poller. The side pollers are for line detections while the colour poller is for colour detection.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • getColor

        public float getColor()
        Returns the latest value of the colour polled
        Returns:
        a value between 0 and 1, 0 being white and 1 being black

      • getColours

        public float[] getColours()
        Returns the latest array of the colours being polled if the mode is RGB
        Returns:
        a value between 0 and 1, 0 being while adn 1 being saturated colour

      • lineDetected

        public boolean lineDetected()
        Check whether a line is detected or not given a float sensor value
        Returns:
        true if the value is larger than 0.35

      • sleepFor

        public void sleepFor​(long duration)
        Sleeps current thread for the specified duration.
        Parameters:
        duration - sleep duration in milliseconds
